name: Le Pavillon Hotel

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay! A friend of mine and I shared the Deluxe Double Queen room and it was wonderful!! Very well decorated and well worth the money. We had brunch in the Crystal Room which was TRULY FABULOUS! This is a must! I missed the famous PB&J sandwiches they serve for free from 10 to 11pm.. but I heard its a reall treat as well. Staff was friendly and attentive. Will definately return!
reviews.title: French Elegance at its Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night Saturday, Feb. 17. It was way more than we expected! The lobby is gorgeous and the room was great! We were really impressed with the extra attention to detail in our room. It had the prettiest ceiling of any room that I have slept in! You'd have to see a picture to understand. Also, it was such a short, safe walk from the French Quarter. We were there during Mardi Gras and the largest parade was a block or two away. It was the perfect location. We couldn't have asked for more!
reviews.title: Couldn't have been more perfect!

reviews.text: Le Pavillon is a beautiful and elegant hotel. The room we had was not fancy, but clean and comfortable, but the rest of the hotel is gorgeous. The bed was a pillowtop and we slept well, plus it was very quiet in the hotel. We enjoyed the rooftop pool and poolside service very much. There are wonderful comfy chaise lounges so you can totally relax. The PBJ sandwiches and milk served in the evening are a nice touch. We only ate once in the restaurant and it was good, not excellent, but good. There are many good restaurants close by. Mother's is just down the street and if you like oysters you have got to try theirs. The staff was very helpful and efficient. There are supposedly ghosts in the hotel but I was a little disappointed we didnt see one. When we come back to NO, we will definitely be staying at Le Pavillon.
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I picked Le Pavillion b/c a couple of friends mentioned it was a nice hotel and it was centrally located for us (quick ride from airport, 10 minute walk to French Quarter from hotel, etc.). The front desk staff was very pleasant, they even upgraded our room when we checked in. Although the exterior of the hotel looks nice, and the lobby is definitely impressive, the rooms need updating DESPARATELY.
reviews.title: Not at ALL what I expected
If you want to REALLY enjoy a stay at a hotel
reviews.text: First off, the bed was extremely lumpy and old. The HVAC in our room was poor; the room was stuffy, so we turned on the AC, but it made a rattling noise the entire time we had it on (in addition to the bed, it was very difficult to sleep). When we left the room, housekeeping would turn up the heat (the weekend we were down there was unusually cold for NO) and the room would be stuffy again. The bedding was dated (blankets were cheap and our pillows were flat...literally, you could fold them in half and they weren't supportive at all) and carpeting was dingy. The bathrooms are very small and the shower fixtures are old and covered in soap scum.

reviews.title: Order, Elegance, Pleasure, Peace, and Opulence
reviews.text: The words from my review title are from Arthur Rimbaud. He was a French Romantic Poet. He knew some things about Beauty and Romance. If you are interested in these things then you too will Love Le Pavillon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Pavillon is Gorgeous. It is full of Antiques, Antique Art, Chandeliers, Marble and Beautiful Rugs. I have a lifelong interest in Antiques, and I decided to stay in The Victorian Suite, because the pictues of it were so Lovely. It was Fabulous. The Antiques were Beautiful, and the two handcarved Rosewood beds are fit for a King and a Queen.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Food is Yummy. The Lounge is Lovely and furnishes Entertainment. The rooftop Pool is truly---off the hook----. There are a couple of Private cabanas available for those who get lucky. I was able to get one. The Pool is very, very clean, as is the entire Pool and sundeck area.
reviews.title: Le Pavillon THE PLACE TO STAY in NOLA

reviews.text: I also stayed in The Mallard Suite. It has an Antique Canopy Bed and a Jacuzzi. It is smallish, but very well-appointed. The Jacuzzi was clean and in perfect working order. The Marble in the bathrooms at Le Pavillon is Gorgeous. The Wallpaper, Bedding, Drapes, and Rugs are all very nice looking.
reviews.title: Le Pavillon worked for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I appreciate Beauty, and I also like Beautiful Behavior. The staff at Le Pavillon is Incredibly Nice, and they know what they are doing. The place runs like a well-oiled machine. I always got my Food done correctly and served at the right temperature. The cleanliness was Very Good, and this is coming from a Nurse folks, so it isn't easy to pass my inspection.
reviews.title: Le Pavillion's impressive service
Nice hotel, a few drawbacks
reviews.text: The hotel was nice in general. The outside was beautiful, the lobby stunning, the crystal room luxurious. The room that I stayed in ( double queen) was reasonable but nothing impressive. There was careful detail to framed art, and fancy drapes, but I was not 100% comfortable with the cleanliness of the bathroom. It appeared clean but there was mildew and rust, and the tile looked far from new. I also didn't like that I could hear guest walking past my room more than I thought I should hear in a hotel, so I was a little unsure about how much privacy my boyfriend and I were experiencing. On the good side, the TV was huge, lots of channels, and free internet is always a plus.

The pool on the roof is definetley something to brag about, but I was very diappointed when my boyfriend and I went up for a midnight swim and our time was ruined by roaches by the pool and hottub. We spotted more than 3 in the 30minutes that we spent up there so I'm sure there were more. Roaches are not something that I would expect from a 4.5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful lobby, big room, far from french quarter

reviews.text: All together, my boyfriend and I had a great time. He was a super fan of the pb and j! The French Quarter was kind of far, but we still walked and enjoyed the experience.
reviews.title: A really great hotel!
A wonderful memory at Le Pavillon
reviews.text: We stayed at La Pavillion hotel for three nights in May 2007. The hotel lobby is quite beautiful, crystal chandeliers, etc. But during our stay, it was being repainted, and was mostly covered in scaffolding the whole visit.
The best part of this hotel is it's people, The service it outstanding by any means, everyone is cordial and friendly!
reviews.title: A hotel with character, in a city of characters

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Read the TripAdvisor reviews prior to our visit. Let me see if I can provide some of the clarity I was looking for before our stay.
reviews.title: Charm, Class and History

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Pavillon Hotel is a grand, older hotel. It was built in 1907 and is (do the math) now over 100 years old. In my experience there are both advantages and compromises in staying at such a property. I like my history but I also like my latest and greatest features and technology and I'm generally not a B&B guy. Le Pavillon is definitely worth some of the compromises.
reviews.title: One of the BEST
Fantastic
reviews.text: The location is good if you want to be near the Superdome, Central Business District and French Quarter. The good news if you want it a bit quieter at night is that you are very near but not in the French Quarter.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked on Hotwire and as other reviewers have suggested upgraded to a Deluxe King room. Room service was excellent and prompt. In general the service was tremendous from every staff member that we encountered. Very attentive. For example as I was ordering a snack one afternoon the phone seemed to keep cutting out. Before the snack even arrived a maintenance person was there to repair the phone.... And we hadn't reported a phone problem. Will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A Special Hotel

likes.liked: — The sheer elegance of the hotel
likes.disliked: — Lack of surface space & no refrigerator in the room

reviews.text: Went toHotwire to book a last minute get away. I booked not knowing which hotel. I was very nervous, I had never done that before, It was WORTH IT. Le Pavillon, was beautiful. The beds were comfy, it was very clean,. The satff was excellent. We will definately stay there again. It was an experience just staying at the hotel. The pool area was very beautiful. I have absolutely no complaints!!!
reviews.title: Love Le Pavillon

likes.liked: — Thr room was wonderful and the location is perfect

reviews.text: We were visiting from WI and booked a stay for one-night. Excellent service, very clean, wonderful time. The rooms are very nice. Be sure to read the hotel's web-site before staying; I noted the items of interest, i.e., art work, the old Chicago saloon, stairwell history - it was really cool to look for these items while browsing the hotel.
reviews.title: Will stay again - very nice

reviews.text: We moved from the Chateau Sonesta to Le Pavillon after a brass band played under our window until 1:00 am in the Canal Street facing room at the Sonesta. Well, I am actually glad that Chateau Sonesta didn't work out for us since it gave us a chance to experience the elegance and friendliness of Le Pavillon. We stayed 5 nites in a deluxe king room which was spotless, had valet parking and their sinfully good breakfast every morning. All this was part of their summer getaway package which was 170.00 per nite before taxes. Any requests were immediatly granted and their nightly tradition of cocoa and PBJ sandwiches (which I know sounds a bit odd) was very classy. I can't think of anything that they could have done one bit better.
reviews.title: home away from home

reviews.text: I'm from Louisiana and had always wanted to stay at Le Pavillon because it was so beautiful from the outside. The lobby does not disappoint - it's quite spectacular. Service is also fantastic. It's a little small - the two elevators are slow and creaky - but on the whole it's a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great service, great lobby, dated rooms
OMG incredible!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: I was moving my girl friend from Florida to Las Vegas in a moving truck and we decided to stop and spend a couple of nights in New Orleans. We booked a room at Le Pavillon and had an incredible stay. We were worried that the truck would be so big that we wouldn't be able to park it, no worries, they handelled it. The lobby is so beautiful!!!! We got to the room and yes it is small but not so small that you feel crowded (unless you're 6'8 & 450lbs). The room was clean. We had one of our dinners brought to us room service and it was awsome. It was nice to eat this wonderful meal next to the window over looking New Orleans. My girl friend hit the pool late one night and said she liked it (I didnt make it up there). We were able to walk to the French Quarter no problem, and felt completly safe, even stumpling in drunk at 4:00am (we missed the PP&Js). We will most certainly stay there again. Everthing was wonderful, and the price really wasnt bad for a hotel near the French Quarter.

reviews.title: Excellent service at Le Pav!
reviews.text: A collegue and I spent three nights at Le Pavillon for a conference, and were delighted at the staff's eagerness to serve, advise, etc., as well as with our surroundings.

reviews.title: Loved our stay here!
reviews.text: Although I am a regular visitor to nola, it was my first stay at Le Pav. The hotel's entire staff was polite, helpful, and fun. We got to know our doorman and our concierge. The woman answering the phone for room service got to know us, and on our second morning anticipated our our morning call for cappuccino and cranberry juice.

My husband and I stayed at Le Pavillon for one week in June, while he attended a conference in NOLA. Consistent with other reviewer comments, the first room assigned, was small for the large size furniture it was expected to accommodate and it also needed some TLC. When we mentioned our concerns to front desk staff, they addressed each quickly. We had opportunity to move to a larger room, when another couple checked out, and enjoyed it immensely for the balance of our stay. The staff from the front desk, housekeeping, bar and dining room were impeccable in their service delivery and general friendliness.
reviews.title: A historic hotel, wonderful staff

likes.liked: — staff responsiveness, elegance/history of this fine hotel
likes.disliked: — first assigned room too small and not well maintained

reviews.text: We enjoyed the roof top pool and hot tub, cabanas, and the late night peanut butter and jelly sandwich tradition at this fine hotel. The elegance of the hotel, coupled with the warmth of the people we met, made for an excellent first trip to NOLA, start to finish. Le Pavillon, and its staff, will remain a wonderful part of our memories of this great City still recovering "post Katrina".
reviews.title: An Historic Jewel in the Heart of the City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip for the Do it Yourself Traveller: Get a "ride all day" $5.00 pass for the Transit from Guest Services. Take the St. Charles Streetcar to the Garden District to enjoy the fine homes and universities. Consider getting off at Washington Avenue to visit Lafayette Cemetery, and enjoy a snack or meal at the Camellia Grill or Le Madeline at the "end of the line" before catching another streetcar back to the hotel. The stop for the St. Charles streetcar is less than a block from Le Pavillon. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Great Deal at $100 Per Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was built in 1907 and it is located a few blocks away from Canal Street, which separates the old French Quarter area from the other parts of town. You are not in the noisy or rowdy parts of town here, and your accomodations are not strictly as "modern" as they might be at some of the newer properties, but there is a grace about Le Pavillon that is very appealing, especially if you are a grownup (of any age). Enjoy the Victorian feel of the loby and lounge with its glorious chandeliers; and the late night snacks provided in the lobby.
reviews.title: Loved the charm!

likes.liked: — Service was EXCELLENT. Good old Southern hospitality.
likes.disliked: — Some rooms were a bit old.

reviews.text: The management and the staff are nothing but courteous and helpful. Some of our fellow visitors said that their room was too small perhaps, but we could not complain as we were upgraded quite grandly from the room we had reserved.
reviews.title: Five Star Service

likes.liked: — Impeccable service, great location, and beautiful setting

reviews.title: Loved, loved, loved Le Pavilion
reviews.text: After watching Samantha Brown feature this hotel on the Travel Channel, my boyfriend and I decided to stay here for my first visit to New Orleans. It went beyond my expectations! Customer service by the staff was top-notch, the rooms were extremely clean and beautifully decorated and the rooftop pool/spa was a great place to relax! Its close proximity to the French Quarter made it even more special as we could walk back and forth without getting too tired. The PB & J sandwiches were the best! We will definitely stay here on our next trip.

reviews.title: Royalalty in a city of romance
reviews.text: Royal, regal and oh so french!

reviews.title: okay
reviews.text: arrival to this breathtaking structure was art in itself. Feels like your in Paris France. The Hotel feels very feminine in its presence, though men will be attacted to her beauty and wit. This hotel brings out the passion in all relationships- so stay here and find a rekindled romance or start up a new one. The rooms are deep within thought and relaxing to the mind. Beds are comfortable and tastful in design as is the rooms ambiance. The rooftop is a statement of class. Le Pavillion has a roof top pool , with view of new orleans that make anyone want to kiss the night to the wind.

reviews.title: Service, Smiles, and Snacks
reviews.text: The gym is also not just a place to shed lbs. but a great view of the city as well. The restaurant serves a great brunch -tasty, and welcoming are the servers. The hotel is close to the french Quater , but far enough from the parties, and loud noise. It is quiet and a real getaway, with perks of being next to all the action when your ready to let loose. I had a wonderful experience with this hotel, nothing failed....

reviews.title: great hotel in New Orleans
reviews.text: Go for the gold and stay at this hotel and feel like a million ....

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: We just returned last night from NO. We spent three nights here. It was so beautiful on the inside! The service was excellent as well. It is a small walk to the French Quarter, but it isn't far, although after about 10:00 we took a cab back.

reviews.title: Don't want to go home!!
reviews.text: This was my first stay and will definately return! Make sure to eat the waffle w/ ban. foster for breakfast and take advantage of the services (turn down, p.b & J, ect...).

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is a wonderful place to stay in the cess pool of downtown New Orleans. It's an older hotel that has spent untold dollars to ensure luxury at an affordable price. The rooms are somewhat small, but not uncomfortable. The decor is beautiful and the shower was the best I've ever experienced. The shower head dumps loads of water that feels similar to standing under a waterfall. (not stinging; pouring). The bath area is all marble and the swinging glass shower door is very unusual. The concierge is extremely helpful and gives tourist advice, brochures, and good directions. The breakfast buffet is high priced, but well worth it. (about $17). The restaurant (The Crystal Room) is beautiful, but expensive. I would highly recommend at least one meal during your stay. They serve excellent food. The rooftop pool and hot tub are nice, but small. The workout area is very nice. They even have a small fridge full of water and sports drinks, and a basket of fresh fruit (all free) for hotel guests who use the facility. The tradition of serving free peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, hot chocolate, fruit, and milk in the lobby every night is great! We really enjoyed our stay. Parking costs $28 per night (typical in New Orleans), and the valet parking service is ccontracted out by the hotel. The first night we were there, the valet parked our rental car by a wall and put a huge scratch on it. I would recommend parking your car yourself.

reviews.title: More a preview than a review
reviews.text: Not arriving till late August - Halloween week, and the service here has already been outstanding.

reviews.title: Wonderful, relaxing stay
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Le Pavillon in October 93 upon user recommendations, and we were very happy with our room. It was just as described online, and spent some time on the rooftop swimming pool, just relaxing and enjoying the fantastic view. Lots of privacy, courteous staff, quiet room. Being away from the noise of the French Quarter was just fine with us, and it was very easy to catch a streetcar to Jackson Square and we enjoyed hours wandering around the quarter. The PB & J at night was a sweet touch and popular with hotel guests. It was, all in a wonderful stay.

reviews.title: 4 Star Hotel, 1 Star Service!!
reviews.text: First, let me say, I am NOT one of those people that just looks for something negative to say. We travel quite a bit, at different types of lodging and I use tripadvisor EVERY time. I don't know what happened while we were at Le Pavillon 2/17-2/20, but EVERYTHING went wrong! We ordered room service and didn't get the right beverages, TWICE! Our wakeup calls were 10 minutes late, and it took FOREVER to get our car out of parking, and it's only just a lot on the opposite corner. We put a "TURN DOWN SERVICE" sign in our door when we went out, and when we got back, someone had been in the room, put the "TURN DOWN SERVICE" sign back in the room, but hadn't done anything. Why were they in the room then? We called the Front Desk, once, to say, very nicely, that we had had a few problems, they didn't inquire any further and they didn't do anything to make it up to us. I have never complained at a hotel and we didn't push this any further. If you stay there, I hope you have better luck.P.S. Le Pavillon IS very lovely to look at and I didn't think the location was too bad, it's away from the French Quarter, but well within walking distance, just a few blocks. Although, I won't ever stay there again because of the service. I booked this room through AAA and I wonder if we got discount service because of it. I hope that is not the case, but maybe they only cater to the full-paying guests.

reviews.title: Best **** hotel in the world with the best staff!!
reviews.text: I read reviews on tripadvisor.com for months prior to our 4th anniversary excursion to New Orleans. Every week a new review would come up on Le Pavillon and not one negative word was ever written. I must say I was somewhat nervous about getting my expectations up too high and being let down by a staff or hotel that didn't met my standards. NOTHING could be farther from the truth!! We spent three wonderful but rainy days in New Orleans and besides eating at Emeril's (best restaurant aside from the Mansion on Turtle Creek in Dallas) the hotel made our trip the best we've taken in years. Justin, the concierge, was marvelous. I sent him a very lengthy email prior to the trip and he responded in a prompt manner with great ideas! Upon arrival, the hotel sent up a basket of fruit for our anniversary (which I'm still not sure how they found out that's why we were there). The room was spacious and had a very new and crisp feel to it. If you do go to this hotel, make sure you request the "Turn down service" at night. Not only was the bed perfectly turned down the hotel staff left shortbread peanut butter and jelly cookies on our nightstand with the recipe to go along. I'M STILL BLOWN AWAY! As others have said, the Peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with the hot chocolate at 10:00PM every evening were the perfect snack before heading off to bed! I'm never been more confident about referring a hotel to anyone! Stay here, you won't be sorry!!

reviews.title: I really was imporessed with Le Pavillion.
reviews.text: The hotel was a very beautiful historic hotel. I came in with very little expectations, and it they completely blew me away. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Anythign I needed, they were glad to respond. The rooms were very large and spacious.Overall, the stay was excellent.

reviews.title: Great hotel, not so great location
reviews.text: Le Pavillon is everything other reviewers have said. It is beautiful and elegant and the service is top notch. We were looking for a place to stay away from the noise of the French Quarter and we found it. No one told us, however, that the hotel is located in a deserted area where you really should not be walking around. You are 4 solid blocks to Canal St. Cabs are essential at night. I also agree with the comment that the basic room is cramped and needs improved noise insulation. The decor is lovely, though.

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.text: Our recent visit to Le Pavillon was the best. The staff was the nicest people. I was sick one of the days, and the housekeeping staff was so nice, wanting to know if there was anything they could do. In fact, all the people in New Orleans were nice & friendly. I am looking forward to returning to Le Pavillon soon. The location was perfect, close enough to walk to the french quarter, but without all the noise and craziness. Loved the restaurant, food was excellent. Had a great time in the piano bar. THe hotel is beautiful. Would recommend to anyone.

reviews.title: thankfully not a franchise hotel
reviews.text: my wife and i spent last thanksgiving here. what a treat!!! there really is a "grande dame" feel to the place. absolutely stunning lobby with crystal chandeliers beyond belief. the rooms were not huge but were furnished with deep pockets. loved the marble bathroom. numerous staff members asked if we were enjoying our stay-from housekeeping to doormen to f & b manager. this level of interest was not forced and felt quite genuine. we felt quite welcome there. definitely not your cookie cutter franchise hotel at all and why we look beyond the marriotts and the westins to find beds with personalityies.

reviews.title: Average, at best
reviews.text: Sunday April 25, 2004

reviews.title: Drip, Drip, Drip
reviews.text: Just returned today from a two night stay. Arrived late on 4/23. No doorman or bellman. Eventually a security guard arrived to help. Received a smoking room even though we requested non-smoking. Room nicely furnished but smelled of smoke. Had a shower and bizarre half size tub. No in room movies. Valet parking is $25/day (more than the daily rental cost!). On checkout, receptionist was eating a danish as we were checked out. When our car was not ready and informed of our time press to get to airport, I was instructed to "settle down".

reviews.title: Love, Love, Loved the Le Pavillon!
reviews.text: OK property (restaurant had good food with friendly service), over priced lodging rate whose good years are behind it.

we stayed at the la pavillion in july of this year and i can honestly say the hotel and staff were top class everything was as it should be for this hotel and would highly recommenf the hotel to any body going to new orleans it was centraly located 10 minutes walk to burbon street and everywhere u would want to be, the pool was a bit small but very nice in deed on top of the hotel and its open till 1am wich was very welcome to av a swim late at nite, the staff were second to none and the concergie justin was very very helpful as was paula in the reception and mainly all the staff i would highly recomend this hotel to anybody we stayed their for 10 nites on our holidays from dublin ireland the only downside of the hotel was their was no tea or coffe making facilities in the room but as i did not drink either of these drinks i was not to bothered my wife did but with a coffe shop just outside on a side street it was not a problem all in all the la pavillion was a beautiful hotel and if ur going u will av a wonderful time in the 10/10
reviews.title: very nice stay

reviews.text: We just returned from two 2-day stays at Le Pavillion. What a lovely property! The lobby and downstairs is quite grand but elegant, and the rooftop pool is just stunning (fitness center is small, but nice, as well). There is obviously quite a bit of attention to detail here.
reviews.title: service charm style at Le Pavillion
A Beauty in New Orleans
reviews.text: The service was great--we gave the concierge staff a workout and they did a fine job for us, following up on a number of requests. The room (we had a deluxe room both times, on different floors, one w/ king, one w/ 2 queens) is quite nice. I particularly liked the painted ceiling (subtle, but charming). The bathrooms are small but very well-appointed, my only quibble being no place to hang the towel except a hook on the back of the door.
During summer, this was excellent price for value as well. We found the location to be great for both the FQ and the warehouse district--you can get to both easily from the hotel.
reviews.title: Comparable to the Ritz

reviews.text: A Beauty in The Big-Easy (new Orleans)......If you want Noise and Confusion-Get a room in the French Quarter !..But if you want comfort, beauty,quiet,superior accomadations with a Staff ALL dedicated to Outstanding customer Service abd attention to DETAIL-Le Pavillion is the place fpr you.......Only a 4-minute cab ride from the French_qtr and all it's tourist attractions-Yet Quiet and cozy enough to think you are nestled in your very own Mountain_top estate_Le Pavillion IS the BEST of all possibilities in Nwe Orleans.....Amenities include a wonderful cozy lobby_lounge and a Brilliant, Sparkling Dining room_The CRYSTAL ROOM----Where Food and Service are Superb......After a day or two here, you may lose your desire to venture out to the humid, hot, muggy streets of the Quarter-since this Htel pampers you and gives ALL that one could possibly need to Rest, Relax, and absorb the Ambiace of N. Orleans !
reviews.title: Hotel made my whole trip
Gorgeous
reviews.text: This is one beautiful hotel, and for a reasonable price! The rooftop pool and jacuzzi are so nice after a long day of walking around the French Quarter. The rooms are well-decorated, and I even love the bathroom faucets. Free high-speed internet access is a huge plus in my book.

reviews.title: Not an ordinary hotel!
reviews.text: From the second my husband and I arrived at Le Pavillon we knew that we were in for an incredible stay in New Orleans! The staff was outstanding and extremely helpful! The rooms had a warm cozy feel to them and the rooftop swimming pool was also an extra treat. We were visiting for my husbands birthday, so we asked the concierge Justin for a recommendation for a restaurant. He made reservations for us, and after we left, he called the restaurant back to tell them that it was his birthday. On arrival, they had complimentary champagne waiting! It was magnificent! The hotel is also in an excellent location. Easy access to the streetcars and buses, and it is also an easy walk to the river and Bourbon street. I have recommended this hotel to all my family and friends and I will continue to recommend it to anybody travelling to New Orleans. I know on my visit back I will again choose Le Pavillon!

reviews.title: Absolutely gorgeous hotel
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. We went with another couple who suggested it because of a previous stay. The rooftop pool is magnificent. The breakfast is delicious and the location is great. The room was a bit small but this hotel is so charming it is worth being a bit cramped.

reviews.title: Le Pavillion's breach of contract
reviews.text: The decor is rich and plush. We've been to some beautiful hotels but this is definitely one of our favorites! They even offer a midnight snack buffet (but it gets crowded so get there a little early).

reviews.title: Loved Le Pavillion
reviews.text: Le Pavillon, while a beautiful hotel with lots of charm, really has problems with it's staff and catering people, as well as their upper management.Our company booked a meeting to be held April 29th & 30th 2004. After sending our contract requirement to their catering director Gwen DeFraites, our meeting was accepted and booked. We had stated in our contract requirements that any deposits needed would be due two weeks before the event.Now, today, March 15th 2004, the hotel demanded all deposits or the event would be cancelled. After trying to speak with the catering director supervisor, we were basically told tough luck, and they cancelled our meeting there. This is after having advertised the meeting at this hotel and having people register there.This is costing our company large sums of money.Be careful with this hotel!

I had the opportunity to stay in New Orleans for a conference in March '07, and my stay at Le Pavillon was fantastic. This hotel is located in the Central Business District, with a short walk to the SuperDome, French Quarter and RiverWalk.
reviews.title: Warm hospitality, great location and room

reviews.text: The property is meticulously maintained, from the rooftop pool and veranda to the public spaces to the rooms themselves. The service I received was very attentive, courteous, yet warm and personal as well. Everyone we met with greeted us with a smile and helped with everything from personal accommodations for our room to restaurant reservations.
reviews.title: Old Glory, off the beaten path but walking distance to the FQ (daytime only)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One unique service this hotel provides is the nightly "snack time" of peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, hot chocolate, fruit and fresh bread. This long standing tradition is just one example of the "southern hospitality" we received on our trip.
reviews.title: Awesome experience!

reviews.text: I would like to visit New Orleans again in the near future to see more of the city (I was only able to see the French Quarter and Garden District this time around) and I will have no qualms about staying at Le Pavillon again.
reviews.title: peace, quiet, and elegance

likes.disliked: — my room that was gently worn and slightly ton

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: I don't have much time to write a review, except to say the staff is exceptional in most cases. This is an old hotel, on the Natl Registry of Historic Places (or Hotels, something like that). So don't expect six elevators, but DO expect an awesome buffet served up by a woman you wish you'd had as a nanny, and quirks such as peanut butter cookie treats (and sandwiches in the lobby nightly). I stayed there one night and loved the place and its history...my room had an electric fireplace and a wet bar, but with creaky floors and the noisy elevator shaft nearby, I doubt it'd be my choice for an extended business stay.

It's been quite some time since I've stayed here but it's definitely left a lasting impression. For 3 years in a row, I would travel down to New Orleans for Halloween and on this year I chose to stay at Le Pavillon. Previously I'd stayed at The Hotel Intercontinental and The Westin. Nice places but my experience at Le Pavillon far surpassed them!
reviews.title: Le Pavillon in New Orleans is my favorite!

likes.liked: — The look and feel of the hotel

reviews.text: I took two of my friends with me as a gift to them and they were really happy at the hotel choice! We spent a lot of time up on the roof where the pool and whirl pool were ordering drinks and just enjoying ourselves. It was like being at a resort!
reviews.title: Le Pavillon- Greatest Hotel I've ever been to!

likes.liked: — I loved the way the hotel look and the roof top pool view.
likes.disliked: — That the peanut butter and jelly wasn't served for a longer amount of time.

reviews.text: Their fitness center was very adequate and helped me sweat out my hangover on one morning!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in the Big Easy

reviews.text: The room, hotel decor, and staff were superior.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm going back to New Orleans this year after few years and I will certainly be staying at Le Pavillon.
reviews.title: Wow! A MUST!

reviews.text: Another favorite was the peanut butter and jelly sandwiches served at 10:00. That is something they will always remember.
reviews.title: a little more insight to La Pavillon
wonderful experience
reviews.text: Our stay was excellent. Staff was kind and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to everyone, and will stay there again if ever in the New Orleans area.

reviews.title: Great deal, loved it
reviews.text: Stayed at La Pavillon for 3 days with 2 kids. The hotel is beautiful, very lush. The rooms are small, bathrooms even smaller yet everything is very very clean. I would much rather have a small room yet clean than a suite where I cant take my shoes off. The pool is extremely small(dont let the pics on the website fool you) Roof top is fun but all you see are more buildings. Service is exceptional and everyone is very nice. The peanut butter and jelly sandwiches with milk and hot chocolate were by far the biggest hit. Would stay there again if pool weren't so important to the kids.

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay - Would Recommend
reviews.text: We stayed at the Le Pavillion Hotel for 3 nights end of June. This hotel was fantastic. The service was fantastic, the staff was really friendly. Everything in the room was great.

Le Pavillon is by far one of my favorite hotels that I have stayed in. Le Pavillon has so much character and charm. If you like old world charm and historical monuments this is a hotel you must stay in when visiting New Orleans.. It is very beautful and stunning, the employees of the hotel work very hard to keep this wonderful property in great shape and it shows. I have stayed at several Ritz Carlton's in my lifetime and this hotel comes close to those experiences.
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotels!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love its location and the secure feel of the hotel and area in which it is located. Le Pavillon is a very short walk to the French Quarter, only 3 blocks. Did not feel at all threatened or fear for my security when walking to the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!

reviews.text: The hotel staff is extremely accommodating and knowledgeable. They are very respectful, polite and very aware of their guests and their needs. They truly enjoy their jobs and that is hard to find these days, especially in the hospitality industry!
reviews.title: A Hotel to Remember

likes.disliked: — Not closer to the French Quarter.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would HIGHLY recommend this property and I am looking forward to my next stay with everyone at Le Pavillon. Good luck to whomever reads this and I am sure your experience will be as pleasant as mine was.
reviews.title: Amazing Staff and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel upgraded me from a standard to deluxe at check in for no additional cost. Lovely hotel. The employees all were very helpful, courteous and friendly. Our room was exceptionally nice. We did not eat at the hotel. We knew when we checked in that we would have to walk to everything but it was enjoyable. A few blocks doesn't hurt anybody or they can certainly take a taxi. Definitly will return and stay at this hotel! 5 star all the way.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great City
Thanks for the great service, Le Pavillon...
reviews.text: This hotel posted a pre-Christmas special on the internet and we stayed there for 1 weekend night. We reserved the room on the internet and all confirmation went smoothly and professionally. When we arrived we were greeted by very polite and professional staff, and we are amazed by their luxurious decoration in the looby and throughout the building. We took a lot of pictures with their well-decorated Christmas trees and fireplaces. They provided wireless internet access, a very convenient feature for the guest. My wife particularly like the late night snack, which include milk, peanut butter bread, cookies, juice, etc. The location is near downtown. We could walk to French quarter no problem, around 15-20 minutes. Of course you might not want to walk during the night. Safer to take a cab, not too expensive. Room are not huge, but furniture are nice. Room size is about average. Swimming pool and exercise room on the roof, too bad it was too cold to swim when we were there. Their restaurant was luxury too and they have table side cooking. After we return, they even sent several thank you email to us.

reviews.title: Pretty Good
reviews.text: We most appreciate the great service from the staff and they are very professional and helpful. It's a great stay. Thank you.

reviews.title: Perfect Vacation
reviews.text: I really liked this hotel. Very plush and friendly staff. We stayed in the middle of Mardi Gras and they managed to operate very smoothly.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: Massive TV in the room and the hot chocholate, milk, peanut butter and jam sandwhiches from 10-11pm in the lobby were a nice touch. Mini bar is expensive but i guess they always are. For $140 a night it was well worth the money.

reviews.title: terrible service
reviews.text: This was our first trip to New Orleans and our stay at Le Pavillon made our trip memorable and perfect. The entire staff went out of their way to make us feel special. It was the most beautiful place I have ever stepped into. Our room was fantastic, the bed was incredible. The food was first class, as was the service. We will be going back to New Orleans and will definitely be staying at Le Pavillon again.

description: Le Pavillon Hotel is centrally located in the heart of downtown New Orleans. Only 4 blocks from the world-famous French Quarter, Le Pavillon is your go-to hotel for the Spring Festival Season. Secure gated parking is available with unlimited in and out privileges. Le Pavillon has been the recipient of TripAdvisor's "Best Hotels on the Web" Award and is consistently rated by TripAdvisor travelers as one of the Top 10 Hotels in New Orleans.
